components.description:
A blowfish (puffer), which puffs up and becomes spiky when alarmed. Depicted as an orange or brown blowfish in full profile facing left, with small fins, a white underside, and a round, spiky body, as if inflated.

Called fugu in Japan, where it’s consumed as a delicacy.

May be to represent a variety of fish (saltwater or freshwater), fishing, metaphorical senses of fish, and fish as food, as consumed in the form of üç£ Sushi. Not to be confused with üêü Fish or üê† Tropical Fish, though their applications may overlap. See also üé£ Fishing Pole.

Google’s blowfish was previously blue, Microsoft’s yellow, and Facebook’s white.
components.title: Blowfish

description:
A blowfish (puffer), which puffs up and becomes spiky when alarmed. Depicted as an orange or brown blowfish in full profile facing left, with small fins, a white underside, and a round, spiky body, as if inflated.

Called fugu in Japan, where it’s consumed as a delicacy.

May be to represent a variety of fish (saltwater or freshwater), fishing, metaphorical senses of fish, and fish as food, as consumed in the form of üç£ Sushi. Not to be confused with üêü Fish or üê† Tropical Fish, though their applications may overlap. See also üé£ Fishing Pole.

Google’s blowfish was previously blue, Microsoft’s yellow, and Facebook’s white.
title: Blowfish

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A spiky-looking fish¬†which is¬†eaten as a delicacy in Japan, where it is known as fugu. Displayed in a photorealistic style on iOS, and carto http://emojipedia.org/blowfish/
emoji_net_data.name: blowfish

bn:00088236v: Intransitive: to try to catch fish.
To catch or try to catch fish.
Catch or try to catch fish or shellfish
To try to catch fish, whether successfully or not.

bn:00094675v: To move through the water, without touching the bottom.
To move through the water, without touching the bottom; to propel oneself in water by natural means.

bn:00034816n: Any of various mostly cold-blooded aquatic vertebrates usually having scales and breathing through gills
Fish anatomy is the study of the form or morphology of fishes.

bn:00069946n: The sea, the world ocean, or simply the ocean, is the connected body of salty water that covers 70.8% of the Earth's surface.
A large body of salty water. (Major seas are known as oceans.)
A sea is a large body of saline water usually connected with an ocean.
A division of an ocean or a large body of salt water partially enclosed by land
The body of water covering most of Earth
A body of salt water that is smaller than an ocean and generally in proximity to a continent.

bn:00058574n: The oceans, seas, bays, estuaries, and other major water bodies, including coastal marine and nearshore zones.
The mass of water occupying all of the Earth's surface not occupied by land, but excluding all lakes and inland seas.
Oceans are major bodies of saline water, and the principal component of the hydrosphere.
A large body of water constituting a principal part of the hydrosphere
An ocean is a body of saline water that composes much of a planet's hydrosphere.

bn:00011458n: Any of many marine fish in the family Tetraodontidae, especially the puffer or sunfish, that can inflate itself to form a globe.
Any plectognath fish that dilates itself, such as the pufferfish.
Tetraodontidae is a family of primarily marine and estuarine fish of the order Tetraodontiformes.
Any of numerous marine fishes whose elongated spiny body can inflate itself with water or air to form a globe; several species contain a potent nerve poison; closely related to spiny puffers
Any species of fish of the family Tetraodontidae that have the ability to inflate themselves to a globe several times their normal size by swallowing water or air when threatened.
Any species of fish of the family Tetraodontidae that have the ability to inflate themselves to a globe.
